Original manuscript located: UVa Library, call number MSS 10460 and MSS 10460-a

Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
January 28, 1858 from Martin Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor
Careysburg Jan 28 1858 Dr J H Minor

I Hope thes lines may find you well as thes leaves me pleas send me one Boshl of flour one barrel of Pork one barrel of Bacon one barrel of leaf tobaco four pair of No 10 shoes one Role of blue flannel send me a foulen pice send me four Roles of Calico one cage of molases one cage of shugar one Role of Bleach cotton one bag of shots one cage of Powder one Box of soap send me tow umbrellas one for me and one for my Wife one Barrel of corn meal one Box of sodar one sack of salt tow pole Axes tow grubing hoes one Role of Blue Drilling tow Pair of Children shoes 1 No 3 tow pair of Blades one cage of Butter one Role of Kentuckey Janes one set of Tin plates one Dosen of Knive and forkes send me tow Hounds one cage of nails no 4 one no 6
Nothing More at presan Yours Truly Respetufuly Marting Colemane
Martin Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor 1858 January 28
